Package ooga.model.components.moves

Class QueenSideCastle

java.lang.Object
ooga.model.components.moves.PieceMovement
ooga.model.components.moves.QueenSideCastle
public class QueenSideCastle
extends PieceMovement
The piece movement that corresponds to the queen side castle. Has to check that the king and rook haven't moved, and that there are no pieces between them This class should be used via reflection, and should be defined in the GamePiece's .xml file in the nested parameters: 

 <moves>
  <KingSideCastle>
  </KingSideCastle>
 </moves>

    • QueenSideCastle

      public QueenSideCastle​(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String> parameters, int direction, GameBoard gameBoard, GamePiece correspondingPiece)
      The constructor takes the parameters of the move. This includes the change in position of the move, as well as the information about whether this move can take a piece
      Parameters:
      parameters - The map of parameters
      direction - The multiplier used to change the direction that the piece uses
      gameBoard - The board that the piece moves on
      correspondingPiece - The piece that this move corresponds to

  • Method Details

    • getAllPossibleMoves

      public java.util.List<Coordinate> getAllPossibleMoves​(Coordinate coordinates, java.lang.String pieceTeam)
      Gets all the possible moves of the queen side castle, which is a single move if the castle is valid or 0 moves otherwise
      Specified by:
      getAllPossibleMoves in class PieceMovement
      Parameters:
      coordinates - The coordinates of the piece that this move is acting on (the king)
      pieceTeam - The team that the piece is on
      Returns:
      All the possible ending coordinates of the move, which is either a single value or nothing for the castle
